1st.  I am a moderator of the Gladiator group, but I do not feel like 
reminding everyone all the time.

2nd.  I have shut down access to the membership list to prevent 
potential harvesting of email addresses.  I have read about people 
joining yahoo groups just to harvest email addressess.  I would rather 
not have done this, but I do want this community splintered over the 
issue of links.

3rd.  I do not believe it is necessary to have a 1 million groups 
dedicated to a single subject unless each one offers something very 
unique from the other groups and there is enough interested people in 
the subject.  Most of the time, IMHO, that's impossible.  I'm also 
making it clear to the potential people working on a scenario editor 
that if you establish your own group, I expect one of the 
qualifications of being a member of your group is membership in this 
group.  I have the same qualification for the tournament group.

4th.  Frankly, I do not want to have to start moderatig posts.  For 
most cases, I will issue a warning message.  If the problem occurs 
again, moderation of posts will follow for a long time (more than 3 
months).  If you have a problem with something, discuss it with me.  
I'm open-minded enough to hear your complaint out AND re-think it.  I 
also will NOT start moderating posts of all new members unless a 
problem starts showing up.

5th.  On the issue of links, I will make this clear: I need to be 
contacted before allowing links.  If Tom Ricket gives consent, I need 
an email from him expressing consent BEFORE the link is posted; 
otherwise the message gets deleted.  Expect a miniumum of 24 hour 
response before hearing about a request for a link to another group.  
The following is a list of things that will cause me to give an 
automatic NO to the would-be group:
  a)inability to access the archives of the group WITHOUT being a 
    member
  b)all messages of the group are moderated [unless there is a very 
    good reason to do so]
  c)I can't see a direct link between the group and the gladiator 
    group
  d)the other group won't allow a link to this group.  I want an email 
    from the owner of the group [moderator is ok, but I will check the 
    group owner just to make sure] oking it AND I will check to be 
    sure the group owner/moderator is the group owner/a moderator.

6th.  I will tolerate complaints but not personal attacks for 
decisions made as a moderator.  If any person has a gripe about my 
policy regarding links to other groups, email me privately.

This is the way it is until Seth Mitchell (the group owner) changes 
things.
